comments: He\'s a blessing. He really cares about each student. He teaches MAGNIFICENTLY. I hate early morning classes, but even if I\'m sleepy I can still completely understand his lectures. He really takes the time to explain in detail that you as a student will understand. He knows we aren\'t mathematicians but students and he\'s just amazing. He\'s wholesome

stu_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS  AMAZING LECTURES  CLEAR GRADING CRITERIA
comments: His lectures are so clear and the tests were VERY manageable. He gave us two practice tests and 2 pages of notes to bring into the final. He doesnt care that you memorize the material as long as you can apply your knowledge. I would take ANY math class from him and I wish he worked at UCSD full-time. I was so blessed to have him while he was here.

comments: He is usually a professor at CPP, but came here on sabbatical. He\'s a really great professor. He tries very hard to make sure that we understand the material from the very core: not just the "how", but the "why". Gets kind of lost in his own thoughts sometimes but he\'s a good guy nonetheless.

comments: So i was dreading taking math20E, but szpowski is actually an impressive professor. He didn\'t teach out of the book -- which in this class is a good thing --and he made everything really easy to understand. His midterms were similar to to the homeworks, so as long as you did the homework there is no reason not to ace the class.

comments: Ryan as a person seems like a nice guy but as a teacher he seems to rush the course and is more concerned with finishing chapters than making sure his students understand the material. The book that was used was also a horrible book, the hw questions often didnt match the material taught in the book or the questions taught in class.
